intro: Varronia rosei, commonly known as the rosewood tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 15 meters tall, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and its wood is highly valued for its rich, aromatic scent and durability. Varronia rosei is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
